greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k), n>=1, 0<=k<=3n, read by rows: row n gives the coefficients of the chromatic polynomial of the complete tripartite graph K_(n,n,n), highest powers first.
comment: The complete tripartite graph K_(n,n,n) has 3*n vertices and 3*n^2 = A033428(n) edges. The chromatic polynomial of K_(n,n,n) has 3*n+1 = A016777(n) coefficients.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..58, flattened
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Complete Tripartite Graph
formula: T(n,k) = [q^(3*n-k)] Sum_{k,m=1..n} S2(n,k) * S2(n,m) * (q-k-m)^n * Product_{i=0..k+m-1} (q-i) with S2 = A008277.
example: The complete tripartite graph K_(1,1,1) is the cycle graph C_3 with chromatic polynomial q*(q-1)*(q-2) = q^3 -3*q^2 +2*q => [1, -3, 2, 0].
mathematica: P[n_] := P[n] = Expand[Sum[Sum[StirlingS2[n, k] *StirlingS2[n, m]*Product[q - i, {i, 0, k + m - 1}]*(q - k - m)^n, {m, 1, n}], {k, 1, n}]];
Array[T, 6] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 29 2018, from Maple *)
xref: Row sums and last elements of rows give: A000004, row lengths give: A016777.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 06 2012
